Text.val: -- Author: Stephan Huppertz
03.05.2013 JH SCR18105 Removed external flag
11.01.2013 GB SCR17753 Part A/B: Added some BFC programs
03.02.2011 SH SCR16169 Incoming messages: Changed moving files to \error dir, no
longer to subdir; Added exception for MSG18 (moved to handled dir without further handling
06.01.2009 SH SCR14279 Added Part C "Test if all incoming messages are handled"
12.12.2008 SH SCR14224 Added handling to create XML first in temp directories fpr outgoing messages
19.11.2008 SH SCR14051 Added messagetype to filename with timestamp
14.11.2008 SH SCR14103 Added BFC200-O13 and BFC200-O16
06.11.2008 AS SCR14085 additional parameter GM102 pi.batch_processing
-- General initializations
... retrieve email addresses of operators, uses to send them emails in
case of errors in the FCI files for incoming messages or I/O operations
failed for outgoing messages
-- Get directories (60 = new, 61 = handled, 62 = error, 66 = reports)
-- Prepare / create subfolders for directories handled / reports
(files with errors are moved to the 62 \error root directory, there's no need
for sub directories (date/time stamp)
-- Get directory (27 = template directory for FCI outgoing messages)
-- Get directory (67 = temp)
-- Get directory (63 = new)
-- Get directory = 60 (new), if not already known, see "A.Incoming messages"
-- Get directory = 68 (New/End of day check)
.. in case of directory does not exists --> MSGW
... add subdirectories
... create directory if does not exist
... if create of new directorry failed --> MSGW
-- Get files from directory (60) = new
-- All existing files in directory /NEW have to be handeld by BFC200
... get file name

ExpSyntax.val: Trim (Str ({0,2},'9'))&' new incoming FCI files will be handled now'

Text.val: ... Message types 1 -24 are valid
-- In case of an invalid XML file or the file does not contain one of the
24 message types, report the error to the operator
... move XML file to error dirctory
... if failed send another email to the operator
-- In case the input XML file contains reports from FCI, it's not an error, the
file has to be moved to the report directory
-- Some files (messages 18) have to be skipped, the have to be moved to the
handled directory
-- Check if it's a duplixcate message
-- A duplicate message was sent from FCI, send email to operators
... move XML file to error dirctory
... if failed send another email to the operator
... move XML file to handled dirctory
... if failed send another email to the operator

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans ('Moving XML FCI file to the error directory failed')
MlsTrans ('Moving XML FCI file to the report directory failed')
MlsTrans ('Moving XML FCI file to the handled directory failed')

Text.val: ... add timestamp to input filename by default
-- 1. Retrieve the message type form the file (max. 24 incoming / outgoing
messages are possible, only incoming messages are handled in this module)
... add timestamp & messagetype to input filename, if it's a FCI file with
messages
... set back to 0:
... in case of an outgoing message type is detected
... in case of an incoming message type is detected, which
is not supported by Factorlink
... no valid message type exist
... message type 1 -24 exist, set message type for further use
-- 2. Check for valid FCI XML file
-- 3. If no incoming message was detected, check if it's a report
... element <Body> is mandatory
... element <MsgInfo> is mandatory
(XML reports will be not handled, they have to be simply moved to the
report directory, without any further action)
... XML input file is a report
... add date stamp in case of errors
... and finally delete the current handled file if copy was successfull
... Operators gets an email, if one of the previous I/O operations failed
-- BFC200-001 Outgoing message type MSG01
-- BFC200-002 Outgoing message type MSG02
-- BFC200-003 Outgoing message type MSG03
-- BFC200-004 Outgoing message type MSG04
-- BFC200-005 Outgoing message type MSG05
-- BFC200-006 Outgoing message type MSG06
-- BFC200-007 Outgoing message type MSG07
-- BFC200-008 Outgoing message type MSG08
-- BFC200-009 Outgoing message type MSG09
-- BFC200-010 Outgoing message type MSG10
-- BFC200-011 Outgoing message type MSG11
-- BFC200-012 Outgoing message type MSG12
-- BFC200-013 Outgoing message type MSG13
-- BFC200-014 Outgoing message type MSG14
======= DISABLED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE ========
-- BFC200-015 Outgoing message type MSG15
-- BFC200-016 Outgoing message type MSG16
-- BFC200-017 Outgoing message type MSG17
-- BFC200-018 Outgoing message type MSG18
-- BFC200-019 Outgoing message type MSG19
-- BFC200-020 Outgoing message type MSG20
-- BFC200-021 Outgoing message type MSG21
-- BFC200-022 Outgoing message type MSG22
-- BFC200-023 Outgoing message type MSG23
-- BFC200-024 Outgoing message type MSG24
.. in case of non existing template BFC200 turns to MSGW, see for details GB744
-- Get files from directory (68) = New/End of day check
-- All existing files in directory /ENDOFDAYCHECK have to be checked by BFC200

ExpSyntax.val: Trim (Str ({0,2},'9'))&' incoming FCI files will be checked now'

Text.val: -- An incoming message was detected, which was not handled before because of an
system crash
... move XML file to /NEW dirctory
... if failed send another email to the operator
-- else simply delete the file

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans ('Moving XML FCI file to the new directory failed')

Text.val: -- 1. Get the message type form the file (max. 24 incoming / outgoing
messages are possible, only incoming messages are handled in this module)
... set back to 0:
... in case of an outgoing message type is detected
... in case of an incoming message type is detected, which
is not supported by Factorlink
... a valid incoming message exist, set message type for further use
-- 2. Determine the unique sequence number of the incoming message
... and finally delete the current handled file if copy was successfull
... Operators gets an email, if one of the previous I/O operations failed
